website_summaries.verdict: Motion-sensing deterrent means your cat will become afraid of the deterrent, not you.
pros: This motion-sensing, unscented spray uses compressed air to spray your cat, even when you aren't home
This is an ideal solution for cats that urinate on carpet or claw furniture when you aren't home
cons: Some customers found the motion-sensing inconsistent

website_summaries.verdict: This motion-activated repellent works to keep pets well away from trouble zones.
pros: Compressed air is odorless and safe
Convenient motion detector for 24-hour hands-free use
Contains between 80 and 100 sprays and is ozone-friendly
cons: Unintentional activation may cause depletion of air
Significantly more expensive than other repellents

customer_reviews.title: PSST and new Chair 1 - Cats 0
customer_reviews.text: We bought a new Wall Away chair and our two cats were determined to destroy it. Cat off wasn't working so we decided to give this a shot. We placed the can at an angle near the wall behind the chair to cover two sides. The first day our little girl set it off and ran like hell. She did keep slink/stalking the corner for a while afterward but hasn't attacked the chair since. Our Tomcat watched the event and steered clear for a couple of days. When he finally decided to claw the chair it was the exact same behavior. Neither of them have tried to claw the chair in the past week.
customer_reviews.author: J. Saeler

customer_reviews.title: Keeps cats off tree, I have 8 MaineCoons
customer_reviews.text: Love this, keeps my 8 cats off the Christmas tree, and helps with training them to stay off counter. Bad thing is though you’ll go thru refill cans quite a bit. Not one ornament has been knocked off yet, and my tree went up day after Thanksgiving.
customer_reviews.author: Katrina B

customer_reviews.title: You have better odds to win the lottery, than to get this sensor to work.
customer_reviews.text: As many have pointed out, the sensor does not work very well. I’ve had the product for a few days now and it is as random as the odds to win the lottery. When it works our cat definitely runs for the hills. The problem is after a while our cat will come back to it, walk by it, sniff it, and the sensor doesn’t go off. I will returning it for a full refund. This looks like a cheaply made sensor.
customer_reviews.author: French Montana

customer_reviews.title: It works on Skitty!
customer_reviews.text: This product does just what it's supposed to do. I had to discount one star because one can only produced a few sprays and was empty. The other can is still working after two months - not that it gets too much use now. Once my cat encountered that hissing puff of air, she hasn't bothered to go back to that area. Also, I found that a can of compressed air works just fine with the sprayer. Since my one can seemed to deplete so fast, I tried a can of compressed air and it works fine.
customer_reviews.author: hollandot

customer_reviews.title: Can drained quickly after device constantly fired when first turned on and initialized.
customer_reviews.text: Followed instructions by inserting batteries, turning it on, and putting it in place so it has time to activate after 2 minutes. Came back 15 minutes later and the can was nearly empty, apparently after constantly firing once it initialized, even when it was literally pointed in the corner of a room.
customer_reviews.author: Mikey B

customer_reviews.title: This stopped door kicking @ 3am
customer_reviews.text: I ended up getting two of these, one from Amazon, and one from Petco(Who price matched their website) This has effectively stopped the 3am door kicking/handle rattling from two boys who demand to be fed at that time. I did use some command hooks + rubber bands to keep them in place as the blast is enough to knock them over. I also did grab 2x AAA rechargable batteries from Ikea, so there hasn't been a need to change out the batteries yet
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Z

customer_reviews.title: Works Outside!
customer_reviews.text: thing rocks - even outside - Ive had one of these outside for 3 months now (with temps down to 6 deg F) and it has worked without fail - great for keeping nosy racoons from using my back deck steps as a commuting path... the outdoor camera has some great encounters - who knew a blast of air could be so powerful.... I posted a video of our Neighbor’s Olympic Gold Gymnist Cat’s recent encounter.....
customer_reviews.author: JoeMamma

customer_reviews.title: May work for a more timid animal
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to dicourage my cat from using the dog door. The first couple times worked to scare him off but after a few more times he got used to it and went in and out the dog door without even being phased. If you have a confident cat, I'd recommend you keep looking for a solution to your problem.
customer_reviews.author: UNTEagle

customer_reviews.title: Works great on countertop.
customer_reviews.text: I've known for weeks that one of my heathen feline children has been jumping on top of my microwave and traipsing across my countertop to the kitchen sink. So, I set on of these little buggers up. Today, I've heard pssst. PLOP. A minute later pssst. PLOP. I love this thing! It did take me a whole day to figure out how not to spray MYSELF every time I walked to the counter. I'm a slow learner sometimes. 😉
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worthless
customer_reviews.text: It rarely goes off. I have it on the floor in an attempt to keep the dogs out but you walk by it and it goes off 10% of the time and our dog walks right by it! Really love our petsafe dog door but this is a very poor product. I hate giving one star but it just does not work at all for me and it's too late to return on Amazon 😞
customer_reviews.author: Chuck and Andy

customer_reviews.title: Not quite as harmless as advertised
customer_reviews.text: This worked well. After 4 encounters, my cat does not try to jump on the kitchen counter any more. However, I am going to see if I can find a canister of canned air or something else that does not have this chemical. If you look at the photo, you will see that there are warnings if this gets in your eyes ( or a pet’s), or if you inhale it. Luckily, my cat has not seemed to have any ill effects, but one time she put her nose right up to it when it went off. So it’s a concern. That’s why I gave it 4 stars instead of 5.
customer_reviews.author: CT gal

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: We have 2 cats who like to hang out on our kitchen counter at night. We tried all different methods (mats, etc) with no prevail. They would figure out how to get around it. The first night we used this the female cat got hit with the air and since then has not gone back on the counter. The male cat is a little more testy. It took about 3 nights before he didn't even try to go back to the counter. He looks up and if he sees the bottle he walks away. Yes! We win. Finally a product that works.
customer_reviews.author: Jns

customer_reviews.title: It goes off when triggered, but the problem is ...
customer_reviews.text: It goes off when triggered, but the problem is that it doesn't stop; even when the stimulus is out of the eye's detection. My entire can has been discharged in only three activations.
customer_reviews.author: E

customer_reviews.title: works, but eats batteries like crazy!
customer_reviews.text: We don't want our cat to jump on the dining room table or the kitchen counters, but all our scolding only taught him not to do it when we were around. SSScat kept him off the counters when we were not there. Great! But... this thing eats batteries like they're popcorn. We've tried both rechargeables and disposables and in both cases, they never last more than 2 days. And it takes 4 batteries so that's a whole lot of waste! We were only keeping it on while we're at work so that's like 16 hours total that you'll get out of 4 AAAs. Ridiculous !
customer_reviews.author: Veronica

customer_reviews.title: Enjoying Christmas again!! Don't believe anyone who doesn't like it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought 1 can for my 4 cats, my mother bought 2 cans for her 20 cats... And we are both celebrating Christmas in full stride again this year!! We just put it on the floor to the back of the tree so it didn't spray ever time we walk by. My mom's tree is by some furniture that the cats could easily get on and go in the tree from half way up and not be sprayed, but they are so uninterested in that tree now that they don't even care to try! This stuff is AMAZING! UPDATE: 1 can lasted about 3 weeks with an avg of 7 sprays a day.
customer_reviews.author: Lacey Jae

customer_reviews.title: I just got this in the mail yesterday. The ...
customer_reviews.text: I just got this in the mail yesterday. The can is already empty!! Either my two cats are completely undeterred by this thing or I got a defective unit. I noticed when I first turned it on and tested it, it sprayed nearly half the can out, for about 5 seconds!
customer_reviews.author: Heather Leigh

customer_reviews.title: Great - when it works
customer_reviews.text: When we first go this, it worked GREAT. We would chuckle when we heard the ssssssssssss sound and the thud of a cat jumping off the kitchen counter. However, one month later, it doesn't work. The air blows continuously and won't turn off. We're replaced batteries and cans. Nothing.
customer_reviews.author: Love2sew

customer_reviews.title: keeps the cats off the counter
customer_reviews.text: Ssscat is an easy way to train the cats to stay off the kitchen counters. We put them at specific spots and turn them on when we're not around, and if the cats jump up they get hissed off. When we're working in the kitchen, its easy to just move the Ssscat out of the way. The sensor works very well initially, but gets slower over time and eventually needs new batteries. Uses 4 AAA batteries. The spray can lasted about 6 months. We still put them on the counters when we'll be away and late feeding the cats, but frequently don't bother and the cats are staying on the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Eliz

customer_reviews.title: Really did make the cat SSSCAT!
customer_reviews.text: Have been having a problem with our cat scratching at the bedroom door and digging at the carpet. Put this out last night when we went to bed, and shortly afterwards we heard the "Psssst!" of the canned air, and the cat leaping out of his skin and tearing back down the hallway. It didn't go off again all night (that I heard). The cat wasn't even waiting in the hallway for us when we came out to feed him. Now I kind of feel like a bad cat mom for scaring him like that, but...the clawing and digging really did need to stop!
customer_reviews.author: Jill McAlester

customer_reviews.title: They don’t tell you what’s in it for a reason
customer_reviews.text: Nowhere in this listing do they say exactly what’s in this product, only that it is “safe”. I took them at their word, but on the back of the can you can see that it consists of a chemical compound called TRANS 1 3 3 3 Tetrafluroprop-1-ene. A quick google search will tell you that it’s a eye and skin irritant. This is the “shock collar” equivalent for cats. So before you use this to deter your cats from jumping on counters or scratching on closed doors, maybe spray it in your eyes first and see how it feels. Needless to say I will be returning this. Shady marketing. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: butters867

customer_reviews.title: Top-heavy = tippy, and pricey, but effective!
customer_reviews.text: Solved the issue with my cat spraying one area of the carpet in the corner of the room. Now even if the can isn't there, she avoids that area even if a toy is tossed over there she will turn around and run away. It is a nice reassurance when you are away. Biggest issues are: 1) It tips over easily especially on carpet, as others have said. You need to put it on a little board or something and/or fasten it down. 2) It goes off easily when people walk by it, so obviously that reduces the life of the can.
customer_reviews.author: E. D. Keithcart

customer_reviews.title: Hmmmm ....
customer_reviews.text: Produce requires 4 AAA batteries that are conveniently NOT included. Once we got them, they lasted roughly 36 hours - enough time for my husband to learn to stay away from the toaster, and he now also refuses to go anywhere near the sink. We replaced the batteries and finally the product did activate and blast the cat, who turned and looked at it quizzically before carrying on with exactly what he was doing. Great concept but now I need to train my cat to do the dishes.
customer_reviews.author: JMc

customer_reviews.title: Pricey, but solved my problem.
customer_reviews.text: I would give this thing 5 stars, but $35 is an absurd price. I personally think it's too expensive, but I was desperate to try ANYTHING to get my cat to stop scratching my door at night. This works! It's the only solution I've found. Batteries last a long time; I forget it's on a lot and set it off myself by accident and it hasn't died yet! I've had the same batteries in it since I bought it, I wanna say it's been close to two months. Super easy to set up. Again, only drawback is the price.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Tracy

customer_reviews.title: BEST deterrent ever....
customer_reviews.text: Six cats....one countertop....endless curiosity....territory marking on side of refrigerator....took only three days to ‘train’ ALL of our furry kids to stay off the counter. PERIOD!! Our honors level feline did an end run behind the can and we caught him on the counter....the funny thing was he was tiptoeing and constantly eyeing the can while he inspected the countertop....I slowly placed my hand in front of the sensor on the can...it went off...so did he...landed on the floor and was into the next room before the spray sound stopped. So, yeah, it works for us. Wish we had bought this years ago. The cats are glad we took so long to find this.
customer_reviews.author: Monique M. Richison

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: As a cat training tool, it definitely works. For the first week the batteries ran out rather quickly and the cans were about half full. The sensor picks up movement from about 10 to 12 feet away which is much more than described in the product description. This makes it hard if you’re trying to cook in the kitchen and keep the cat off the counter at the same time. What I have done is leave the cans turned off when I’m in the kitchen . Then when I am away for several hours I set up the cans in strategic places and it seems as though the cat is learning to stay off the counters.... Work in progress
customer_reviews.author: Melanie L. Siemon

customer_reviews.title: Too expensive and too few sprays per can. Can should be larger in diameter, to prevent the SSSCAT from toppling over
customer_reviews.text: They work good, but are really expensive, considering the small number of "sprays" that you get out of each can. I really wish the company would make a 14-oz can (about the same size and dimensions as a can of automotive freon), because (1) these cans are too small- they only last for about 100 "sprays." and (2), the can diameter is too small. The SSSCAT device makes the can top-heavy, and it topples over too easily, especially when the can is nearly empty.
customer_reviews.author: Howard W Gerald

customer_reviews.title: Definitely scared my cat from jumping on the counter
customer_reviews.text: It took me awhile to get the correct angle for the motion sensor. My cat likes to jump on my kitchen counter and in my house that’s a big no-no. I got it ready before I went to bed and in the morning a couple things were knocked over on my counter and the kitchen rug looked like she slid on it. During the night she must’ve jumped on the counter and it got her so she made a mad scramble. Now she goes no where near it. I thought the product was expensive but if this solves my problem than it’s worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Patty White

customer_reviews.title: Pricey for only partially effective and extremely wasteful.
customer_reviews.text: First can lasted one day. One. We put it everywhere possible in a pretty large kitchen, but human activity set it off, even from 8-10 feet away. It was effective--while it lasted--if a large cat jumped near it, but the smaller cats did not seem to trigger the sensor. Partially effective, but not worth the money for us.
customer_reviews.author: K. McKinney

customer_reviews.title: Scares cat and wife
customer_reviews.text: Very sensitive but highly effective. Our cat has only been blasted once on two different pieces of furniture and he has not attempted to jump up again on either, so far. Blasted the wife every time she walked by the dresser. She still keeps climbing in the bed though. So far.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Does not make sound consistently
customer_reviews.text: This thing has never worked consistently. I don’t mean that the cats don’t respond to it. When it makes the sound it is supposed to, the cats do respond. But it almost never does that. I have tried everything. I change the batteries, and it still doesn’t consistently work. Sometimes it makes a soft click instead of the sound it is supposed to make. I can’t believe I wasted $35 on something that does not work.
customer_reviews.author: Elle

customer_reviews.title: was disheartening
customer_reviews.text: Defective product right out of the box. The motion sensor did not detect at all, and when it did, it released a spray that was seconds longer than it should have been (meaning I would have used up the can faster than I should). I've purchased a working one months ago that would automatically release a short burst of air, and I'd bought a second one (this purchase) thinking it would be at the same standard. Comparing these two was disheartening. I had to ask for a refund immediately, and luckily it was complied but they did not ask for the item to be returned which makes me suspicious if this is a frequent occurrence.
customer_reviews.author: CC

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Started with this. It startled my VERY stubborn kitty but didn't teach him anything other than how to knock it over. It ended up being a waste of money, especially since you have to replace the air canisters. The spray mechanism is like $30 and then each additional canister is another $15 and they don't last that long. The PetSafe ScatMat is waaay better. More expensive from the get-go but actually works and all you have to replace is the batteries. Along with getting an automated feeder so he would have less motivation to search my counter tops for stray snacks, this basically cured my kitty's counter-walking habits.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: Some of the reviews say it doesn’t work. It totally worked for me. We have a glass dining table and the kitties would walk all over it at night. Leaving their paw prints all over it. After getting this product we set it up on the dining table. Saw two prints only on the first night. It’s been almost a week and zero footprints now for days!! Totally fixed an annoying issue. Now I can keep my plant there without it having little nibble marks. I would say the sensor is pretty sensitive it actually got me once or twice but no smell and just a small blast of air. I would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Kind of works, but not well
customer_reviews.text: The movement sensor picks up things that are off to the side and behind it a good twenty feet away, which makes it go off just from crossing the room opposite where it is located. This kind of defeats the purpose of using it to correct our cats, since it basically sprays anytime someone moves within the entire room. It needs a more defined sensor area. I will be looking for a better product rather than wasting money on this again.
customer_reviews.author: comfortare

customer_reviews.title: Awesome cat training tool
customer_reviews.text: The SSSCAT trainer is really great! The sensor could be more accurate and reliable. It's a little moody. I frequently have to reset the canister in order to kick the sensor working again, but overall a great product. If you're looking for a way to train your cats to stop scratching/pawing at your bedroom door at night, from going underneath the couch, climbing around the bottom of the couch, or climbing on the counters, this works! (It does make our dog a little neurotic though.)
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: No more broken tree ornaments!
customer_reviews.text: I was trying to keep my cat away from the Christmas tree - after he'd already broken a few ornaments - and putting the vacuum cleaner next to the tree detracted from its beauty, so I ordered this and it did the trick. After just one encounter with the spray, kitty never went close to the tree again. I can't say as I blame him - it got me good once and scared the beejeebus out of me. One, small complaint is that sometimes it doesn't go off but it did the first time and that's all the cat needed to learn to STAY AWAY!!! I will definitely use it again next year!
customer_reviews.author: LA Rider

customer_reviews.title: Works! My Cat Is Scared To Death
customer_reviews.text: Put my Christmas tree up yesterday. I turned on SSSCAT. My cat went to checkout the tree and HISSS.... He jumped a mile! My cat has never feared anything that I am aware of. He set it off a few more times yesterday running away quickly. This morning he wouldn't come down stairs. He just sat on the top step meowing constantly. He never does that. I turned off SSSCAT this morning and he won't go near the tree. He runs by it quickly. Poor kitty I didn't mean to scare him out of his wits. Product works as advertised. I bought this as I have a flocked tree and was concerned about him eating some of the flocking.
customer_reviews.author: Larry N. Covington

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy! It is not returnable! Replacement canisters unreasonably expensive!
customer_reviews.text: The product scared my cat maybe twice when we had it on the floor. After that it only worked if we moved it to a different spot. We can put it on the counters in the kitchen and it keeps him off. However it doesn’t have a very large canister of compressed air so a persistent animal will have it gone quickly. The replacement cans are $25. Ridiculous. The other thing is that you can’t return it because of the compressed air canister being shipped. So I’m stuck with a motion sensor without an air canister. I’m not happy with this purchase at all.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry

customer_reviews.title: That's all it sprayed??
customer_reviews.text: There's no way I recommend this product. It sprayed maybe 6-7 sprays and it stopped working. The can has air/stuff inside, you can feel it and hear it. I cleaned the sensor and the head. Nothing. It sprayed 6-7 times and it was mostly us, not the cats. They walked right past it on the stove and nothing happened. Exactly where I do not want them to walk. No thank you. It was $35, it was $5/spray! My God!
customer_reviews.author: pawesomegirl

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't going to get this because of the negative reviews, but this has been amazing so far. We started putting it on the dining table since I have one cat that always jumps up there and stares at me in a taunting way whenever he's hungry. This has spooked him right off and now he avoids it. We've also had luck using this outside our bedroom door at night. Our other cat hasn't scratched at our door since. I want two more, but they are way too expensive for what they are. It DOES work in the dark, and it thus far has only gone off when we've wanted it to. It did startle me once!
customer_reviews.author: Christa Lagler

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing.
customer_reviews.text: This stupid thing! It didn't deter my cat. She quickly (like, within a day) learned that if she ran by it quickly she wouldn't get sprayed, if it went off at all. It did spray every time my husband even thought about getting near it. There were so many wasted sprays! And now, even though it *should* still have plenty of air left, the spray is quiet and wouldn't frighten a kitten. (Ask me how I know.) This product might work for certain situations, but in our house it was useless. I can't believe I paid that much for nothing.
customer_reviews.author: hybroanglid

customer_reviews.title: Works well but expensive refills that don’t last long
customer_reviews.text: Works like it’s advertised to do. Even scared me a few times. But the can does not last as long as advertised. The spray seems to use way more than it should when the motion detection goes off. If they would tweak how long it goes off than maybe it would last longer. I’ve seen people say they just used compressed air cans and that works fine. I tried to get the nozzle off one to put the device on but punctured the can on the process. I’ll try again. I’m not willing to pay $14-15 for a name brand refill that won’t last as long as advertised. But the concept of this works well to keep cats away.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki G.

customer_reviews.title: Your cat will definitely scat!
customer_reviews.text: I used this stop a cat from peeing on the sofa. I turn it on when not in the room. The motion detector is a bit wide so movement to the side is detected making it difficult to move around the room without setting it off. Additionally we purchased 2 but only one worked. So far though for the one we have it works well and it has been over a month and is still working without having to replace the compressed air.
customer_reviews.author: WGZGRL

customer_reviews.title: A waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money. I optimistically ordered two units, hoping to keep our two cats from approaching our bedroom door at 5 AM. One unit is completely nonfunctional out of the box, the other is nonfunctional in low-light conditions. The one functional unit will help keep cats off the counter while I make dinner in the well lighted kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Darin Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Not happy so far, defective#1
customer_reviews.text: Buyer beware, I have ordered another to see if it works. The first one I ordered is defective, and I have reached out to seller, 3rd party. I have ready started a conversation with Amazon Customer service as well. The first sprayer we have recieved so far, does not go off with animal, or person walking in front of it. We have tried many batteries, it is just defective. I have not heard back from seller, and it says due to flammable material cannot return. I am very upset as this is for my elderly mother. We shall see if something gets resolved with seller, then I will update my review.
customer_reviews.author: mel1972

customer_reviews.title: Yay, our cats hate it! 3+ year user, pretty happy overall
customer_reviews.text: This is the only thing that keeps our cats from pawing our bedroom door all night! Concept: 5 stars. Execution, 4.5. Value, 3.5. I've owned 3 over the years and they work pretty well. One doesn't detect motion very well anymore, seems to only go off after about 30 seconds instead of right away when detecting motion. But I believe that's the oldest one at about 3 years. The other two are going strong. My main complaint with these is the value; replacement cans are $15 and in our house they only last about a month. Seems like a steep price for canned air, but we can't live without 'em, so what are we going to do?
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Works with caveats
customer_reviews.text: We have 4 cats we wanted to keep away from the Christmas tree. So far, 3 of them have triggered it. Two are afraid and took off running. The other just sat next to it under the tree. The bigger issue though is that it’s too sensitive. It’s supposed to trigger up to 3 feet. It easily triggers at 6 feet. Which means we set it off constantly walking in our living room. Which will make this crazy expensive. I’d call it a fail that you can’t adjust the motion control.
customer_reviews.author: HLLB

customer_reviews.title: SAVE YOUR MONEY
customer_reviews.text: First off, THIS IS NOT RETURNABLE!! The motion sensor does not go off unless I'm holding the can in one hand and waving my other hand 1 foot or less in front of the sensor. I bought it to keep my cat from using behind my couch as a litter box. She walks right by.. it will not go off if on the floor.. It is not near heat or a/c. People, animals nothing sets it off. I pick it up... it starts spraying.. WORTHLESS... $35 bucks gone in a flash for a can of AIR..... no other purpose for this product! If you are like me, and don't have money to throw away.. click off this FAST..
customer_reviews.author: JustMe

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for cats AND dogs!
customer_reviews.text: Sooooo if you have a dog or cat that likes to go back to places you told them not to, TRY THIS! :) We used it on our doggies when they were puppies to keep them on their bed at night while we were training them....now we use it in the kitchen at night to keep the cats from jumping on the counters to loot. I wish the motion detector itself wasn't so expensive, but they last a pretty good time (our first (2) lasted about 6yrs before it stopped sealing to the can - letting air out). It's a bit loud though, when the sprayer goes off, so I wouldn't put it anywhere near bedrooms.
customer_reviews.author: ColoradoBean

customer_reviews.title: Great concept but not efficient or affordable and doesn't work after a while.
customer_reviews.text: This thing works great on 4 out of 5 of my cats when it actually works. One just sits and stares, contemplating on his next move but he's not afraid of the vacuum either. After the first can was spent, I reluctantly bought another can (of air). The sensor works sporadically now and rarely goes off. I can walk by it, crawl by it, stand in front of it and wave a hand.... nothing. Then turn to walk away and it will sssspt. *Huge eye roll. Not worth the money spent in my opinion. And the cans are refillable with a bicycle pump so don't waste your money buying new ($15) cans of air.
customer_reviews.author: 13@heart

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: This thing works, no question!! It has startled me a few times when I forgot I had turned it on. It only took a few nights of setting it up and my two cats do not even attempt to jump on the kitchen counters. I love our cats...but that is just gross. Thank you for your help. No yelling at cats. I think they think it is a giant cat that is hissing at them. Lol.
customer_reviews.author: AvidReader

customer_reviews.title: Worked for me
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this because my very active cat wants to go out on the lanai after dark, when I close the sliding Honeycomb Shades she will try to open and was afraid she would tear them. I purchased this and after only ONE night she was afraid to go by opening, we are on 2nd week and I do not even turn it on, when she sees the can in front of shades on the floor she stays away!!!!! It worked for my very smart cat. She still proceeds to wander the house looking for a window but thats okay, she can open the Bahama shutters!
customer_reviews.author: Fancy Goldfish Fish Lady

customer_reviews.title: It works but it mostly just scares me
customer_reviews.text: A couple of observational notes: 1. Of course the places I was trying to keep my cat away from are also the places in the house I frequent most. Meaning I was the most frequent victim of the spray deterrent. 2. The aerosol cans don't last for very long, and the replacements are v expensive. 3. It's light-sensitive so sometimes just sprays in the middle of the night which was startling. 4. Eventually my cat figured out a way to evade the spray can's detection which rendered it ultimately ineffective.
customer_reviews.author: Jake Ian

customer_reviews.title: Very entertaining!
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I’m giving this product 5 stars is for the entertainment value. It is simply the funniest, most entertaining thing I’ve purchased since COVID 19 quarantine. I bought this device to keep my counter surfing cat off the kitchen counters, and it sort of works for her. If say she triggers the motion sensors 50% of the time. My mother, however, triggers it 100% of the time. I often hear her yelp in surprise as it sprays a puff of air at her. TL;DR: it sort of works for cats, but is great for humans. 10/10 would recommend for human kitchen thieves.
customer_reviews.author: Brianna Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Works, but is expensive
customer_reviews.text: The motion detector works really well for a while, then appears to lose considerable sensitivity after a few months of use, even after changing the batteries. I am on my sixth motion sensor head due to the sensors ending up quitting working entirely. However, these are the only things I have found to keep pets out of areas - like by our front door where our very dumb mini Italian Greyhound and our geriatric cat both like to pee. Also, the refill bottles are EXPENSIVE -- $15 for a can that last about two weeks is not cheap. But it is either that or our wood laminate flooring getting ruined.
customer_reviews.author: Brett

customer_reviews.title: Works most of the time
customer_reviews.text: It's actually really sensitive and sometimes goes off when I move it. Works in the dark, have heard my cats getting sprayed while I'm in bed. When I forget it's on, it startles me sometimes when I come home. I don't consistently have it on so my cats are confused about when it might be on or not and will still try to approach it when feeling brave, but they're definitely more wary of the front door now. The original can is still going after a week, but we'll probably need to replace it because it will spray 3x whenever someone comes home (1. opening door, 2. person coming in, 3. shutting door)
customer_reviews.author: Funkybookworm

customer_reviews.title: Will be buying several more.
customer_reviews.text: If you watch my video you’ll notice my brand new sofa is covered in plastic drop cloth & my floor covered w/newspapers. My cat has been going outside the litter box. I tried clicker training (the sound of which resulted in more eliminating out of the box), spray cleaners, nothing has worked. This little device shows a lot of promise. I’m going to buy several more. Only complaint is it sprays when I walk past even at a distance. Perhaps I can adjust this? I have to look into that.
customer_reviews.author: E.M.

customer_reviews.title: It works well, so worth the price
customer_reviews.text: Our cat had a bladder infection and developed a habit of urinating on the floor around our ping pong table, and continued once the infection was treated, despite using every expensive repellent known to man. We set two of these up in a triangular fashion covering the area. We noticed an area rug scooted awry the next morning--it must have scared the bejeebers out of her. It corrected the problem, and now the can just has to be present for the cat to avoid any area in which it is placed. I wish I had spent the repellent money on this instead.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine M. Brooks-fava

customer_reviews.title: Short-Term Solution
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited to get this, as my cat scratches and yells at our door. It is very easy to use and replace, but with how active cats are, it was used up in 3 or 4 days, before any real training can kick in. My cat was also able to trick it pretty easily. She'd be a foot away, and it wouldn't always register her. I cannot afford to keep replacing it, so after the original can was empty, I just gave up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Yasssss!!!
customer_reviews.text: The video says it all, wish I had found this before they started ripping up the carpet!
customer_reviews.author: Danithestylist

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Deterrent
customer_reviews.text: We have lots of cats, they don't all get along, which means we can have "territorial" problems, which leads to "territorial" marking. We were at wits' end, but this device worked! The cats approach, are squirted, leap into the air, and don't come back. Afterward just the sight of the device is all that's needed to deter them from the spot you want to keep them away from. Of course, it only keeps them 5-6 feet away, so you may need several, as we do. Totally worth it from our perspective.
customer_reviews.author: Jeri O.

customer_reviews.title: Works for the most part
customer_reviews.text: The motion detection is a big iffy - sometimes it'll trigger when I'm walking across the room 10 feet away, sometimes it'll completely ignore things moving wildly in front of it. Mostly it works somewhere in the middle. It does keep cats and even the dog away from areas I don't want them to be but it only lasts like a week or two before you need a refill so long-term it's not very useful, more of a method of training your animal away from certain areas. I'm still buying a refill for now, but I do wish they had a larger canister I could buy.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Winfield

customer_reviews.title: Finally something that works!
customer_reviews.text: I've had trouble with my cats treating my large indoor houseplants as litter boxes. I've tried deterrent sprays, foil, spike strips, water guns, everything. I received this thing a few days ago, created a little stand for it behind the tree, and now all of the cats (and the dogs) are terrified of going near the tree. One cat just sits at a safe distance and stares at it for the half the day. They are completely avoiding the other large houseplant also, even though it doesn't have one of these guarding it. I've been trying to solve this problem for years and even gave up and spent several years without plants. I'm so happy to have found this!
customer_reviews.author: Dori B

customer_reviews.title: It arrived non-functional
customer_reviews.text: I followed the instructions for putting it together and inserted the batteries. Nothing. I took it apart, took batteries out, tried new batteries. Nothing. It's not returnable, but I will say though that Amazon was on it as far as a refund. I will order again and hope it's an anomaly, considering it has a decent rating from others.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Wildner

customer_reviews.title: Works sometimes.
customer_reviews.text: This worked fine the first night, and I think cured one of the cats from peeing on the rug in front of the door. So I decided to move it to the spare bedroom because another cat has developed an affinity for peeing on a rug in there. Now the unit only rarely works, and that is usually when I pick it up to check it. Cat hasn't learned anything yet...I found a fresh pee spot right in front of the unit. Was hoping I'd get more than a couple days' use out of it considering the price.
customer_reviews.author: kittypaws

customer_reviews.title: Keeps My Cat from Scratching the Door AND Keeps Him Off the Counter
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing! My cat would scratch at the door every night, waking me up. I bought this and put it right outside the door and it works amazingly well. Now I only turn it on when my cat starts testing it again, maybe once every 2-3 months. For the counter, I place it in the corner of the counter so it sees the whole counter top. Works there too. Downside is that sometimes the motion detection is spotty. Sometimes my cat can walk right up to it and it not go off. But it goes off enough that it works. Highly recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: M. Scott Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Perfect to stop cats pawing at bedroom door at night.
customer_reviews.text: My 2 sweet cats like to paw at our bedroom door at 3 am for absolutely no good reason. Our cats are beloved by everyone but my husband, and these antics do not help! This product is easy to set up and works as advertised. We have enjoyed blissful sleep and the cats are just fine! I especially love that there is an on/off switch. I’m not sure if it would keep the cats out of a room with an open door or not - at least my cats might just run right past. I wanted to keep them away from a closed door so it worked perfectly for me!
customer_reviews.author: Mom of two

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I bought several of these babies and placed them all over my counters. No matter how I placed them, they went off every time I walked past - and rarely managed to go off when my cat jumped up on the counter. They run out of mojo really quick, likely because they go off all the time. They’re only useful momentarily, like when you’re cooking and want to keep your cat away from the stove, so I’m giving them a few stars for that. But otherwise they’re just not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: littlebird

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love this product
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this product. We regularly foster kittens in addition to our own. For some reason our oldest 13 year old cat likes to poop in a carpeted bathroom. Then the little fosters will try and copy along. We have this installed by the corner and only have an accident every once in a while. Sometimes there is a dark enough kitten that the sensor doesn't pick them up, but it is waaaaay better than it used to be. Very efficient and recommend to other pet owners all of the time.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn

customer_reviews.title: Works great....when it works
customer_reviews.text: This could have been a really nice product. Unfortunately, the motion sensor does not activate but every 10th time it is passed. My cats really just disregard it. I tried everything including new batteries x2, a wipe down, a change of angle, etc and to no avail. I am thinking I just have a defective sensor is all....I think the product could be great!
customer_reviews.author: TMB

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: The spray can it comes with lasts less than a week and the motion detection only works about 30 percent of the time. Refills are costly, if you do it the way they want and continuously buy refills this an endless money pit you'll spend hundreds per year. I bought a small rubber fitting to fit a bicyicle tire pump and I refill it to 80 psi but you have to do that once every few days. Still doesn't work well. If they were to have a built in compressor and a motion sensor that works 100 percent of the time this would be an amazing product, but it's not. This is a total waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle P

customer_reviews.title: Motion detection HARDLY works. !!BUYER BEWARE!!
customer_reviews.text: The motion detection abilities were TERRIBLE. Hardly ever triggered. And out of that handful of times, it is out of sprays in only a few days! Pets could walk right up and sniff it with no response. Really expensive waste of money. I totally regret buying it, and now, even if I wanted to give it another shot, I can't, because that handful of sprays it did manage ran it empty. Wish I could get my money back.
customer_reviews.author: Marissa

customer_reviews.title: SSSCAT Deterrent
customer_reviews.text: I have already ordered some replacement cans, this product works!!! The only reason I didn't give it a solid 5 star was the canister runs out seemingly so fast. Other than that, I love this product. I had trouble with a cat peeing outside the litter box and this device worked!! Because I work such long hours, I could not stop her from doing so but this product has stepped in and done the job for me. She has gone back to using the litter box. Thank you so much BTW, I attended grad school in Knoxville, TN. I know where their facility is. Keep it up, very good product!!!
customer_reviews.author: Ralph Miller

customer_reviews.title: Great for stubborn kitten
customer_reviews.text: I use this to deter my cat from scratching my door at night. If it triggers before she gets to the door, it scares her off. Sometimes, she somehow triggers it, but doesn't completely move out of its range. It will not go off unless she leaves the range and then re-enters it, so this is the loophole she sometimes exploits. I change its position every week or so, that way it triggers in a different area - this seems to keep her from learning the pattern.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working almost immediately
customer_reviews.text: This was extremely effective when it went off correctly, or at all. It stopped working completely days after purchase resulting in my having to purchase another. Initially, it went off periodically without having anything move in front of it. It then settled down & worked sometimes, making the impact I desired, but then completely stopped & it is not returnable apparently because it is combustible. Take your chances, when it works, it's fantastic, when it doesn't, it's a useless cannister of suppressed air
customer_reviews.author: Kay Aay

customer_reviews.title: Throwing crumpled up money at your pet would work better.
customer_reviews.text: There's no stepping over it, if placed on a floor. Even picking it up, to turn it off and move it elsewhere, costs a puff or two. Something that uses something as simple as compressed air shouldn't need to be treated so delicately, but when one replacement can costs almost HALF THE PRICE OF THE DEVICE(?!) you learn way too late to conserve. It's effective, especially for cats, but once it's close to empty, your pet can hear it fizzling out and just ignores the air entirely. It's a great idea that someone else needs to make a competitive product for, because this is the only version currently available, and this one is nowhere near worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: HunterDuke

customer_reviews.title: Move on, try something else (gonna roll the dice anyway?)
customer_reviews.text: The on/off switch broke off. Two of my three units seem to work just fine. the third doesn't seem to "see" and two of the units run out of gas quickly. then the on/off switch broke off of one. I'm really disappointed. Especially, these things, and in particular the refills, are very very expensive for what you get. I'm moving on. Also, connecting a can of duster air doesn't work well. The pressure seams lower and the duster can spray is invisible. The Ssscat gas produces a visible jet of "cloud". Just "air" eh? Pricey and low quality.
customer_reviews.author: MB

customer_reviews.title: The spray is effective; however the downside and why I gave this product a 2-Star
customer_reviews.text: rating is that the cost of the product is costly. You're stuck with this if you cat is indifferent to sound as my latest cat is...I tried both kinds of audible sound and the one only the pet can hear. They both worked on my previous cats but this cat isn't deterred. I decided to "bite the bullet" and buy the collar that emits a static shock to deter UNWANTED behavior. Am hoping that that product works.that UPDATE: The collar works...also have had GREAT luck with the mat that also emits a static shock. Wish I knew about those two, before I bought this product as I would have saved lots of money!
customer_reviews.author: Suzyhomemaker3

customer_reviews.title: Petty cool
customer_reviews.text: In theory .. this works well. When my cat gets the hiss/spray it is hilarious to see him scramble to get away!!! and he will NOT go back more than a couple times coz he forgot. But now .. by Christmas tree, he won't even bother with it. Down side is, the can won't catch every movement and when I moved it to the counter, he jumped up and walked right smack in front of it and it didn't go off. But when I walked by later it did!! 🤔 So the range seems weird. On the floor works better?? I don't know.
customer_reviews.author: DAFS

customer_reviews.title: Poor build quality. No long term use.
customer_reviews.text: I bought three units September 2018 and placed them outside a few windows where some strays were upsetting my indoor cats. They did work at first and I let the cans drains and eventually the strays got the message. Now they're back. I bought new air cans (grotesquely expensive)and lo and behold.. not one of the motion detection nozzles work. 2 of them had rusty or corroded battery connectors but even with cleaning them off, none work. Unfortunately there are no competitors so if I want these to work , I gotta buy three more. Gross.
customer_reviews.author: Kawidood

customer_reviews.title: Great when it actually works
customer_reviews.text: I use this product to keep my cats away from my bedroom door and off the counter. It's a safe, humane way to change their behavior without using any chemicals. I've been using this product for a long time and they've all been hit or miss. Half the time the air can doesn't seat properly resulting in nothing more than a loud click. Unfortunately this was one of those times. If you do manage to get one that works, you can buy a can of compressed air at any office supply store and use that instead of the expensive refills.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel NunlistTop Contributor: Swimming

customer_reviews.title: BLESS THE INVENTOR!
customer_reviews.text: I have one male cat and one female cat. No matter how clean I keep the litter boxes, my cat Bette doesn't like to share so she uses the living room rug as her personal latrine. UGH! I was at my wit's end as you can well imagine!!! So I purchased SSSSCAT hoping it would solve the problem. I placed it on the rug under the coffee table and crossed my fingers. IT WORKED!!! Bette got the message! Today everything is where it should be, in the litter box! Highly recommend this - it works!
customer_reviews.author: Catherine J. Perez

customer_reviews.title: it worked like a charm
customer_reviews.text: This thing works well. It has scared me a couple of times when I forgot about it and didn't turn it off. We were training our kitty to not scratch the door at night. Depending on your area, placement is key. You don't want it in an area where they can trick the motion sensor. Once we found that "right spot", it worked like a charm!!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Fitzpatrick

customer_reviews.title: Solved the problem!!
customer_reviews.text: If your cat is messing around in the wrong areas of your home, THIS product is the answer! There is no scent just a low noise when motion is detected. It works to startle the crud out of my cat when she ventured over to our wood stove. For some reason she has decided that area is her second bathroom (TERRIBLE!). Since purchasing this item we haven't had any problems at all. Completely solved the problem without any issues or harsh chemicals. This is the replacement for one I had already used up. I will continue buying these. They last for months, too!
customer_reviews.author: Birdie

customer_reviews.title: Humane counter-table deterrent
customer_reviews.text: Although we can "police" the counter and table area during the day, it was impossible to guard during the night. This little unit stands guard quite well. The cats hate the sound and stay off during the day because they see it is there and believe it is turned on at daytime. Nice to be able to prepare food on a counter again and sit at the table to eat without ill-mannered persistent pets jumping up where they should not be. We dearly love pets, but tired of sharing food sites with them. It was gross.
customer_reviews.author: RPK

customer_reviews.title: Sprays every time we walk by.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to scare my cats away from Christmas decorations and tree. I bought one early to make sure it works. It definitely scared my cat off the top of the desk. But it also sprays every time we walk by. I would like to know if anyone else has that problem. Is there a way to stop that from happening?
customer_reviews.author: Dave Bluefox34

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this Cheaply made waste of money
customer_reviews.text: This is a terrible item. It is cheaply made. My particular problem with this product is that the plastic top that sits over the can was made incorrectly and therefore it did not have a secure seal so when it is placed on the can the contents leaked out within the course of five minutes. I spent my money on a broken and useless product.
customer_reviews.author: G Notk

customer_reviews.title: No more jumping on the stove!
customer_reviews.text: I have a touch-top stove that I sometimes forget to lock and a cat who loves to look for things on the stove top. Took about 4 sprays to get her to stop jumping on the counter/stove. The days I forget to turn it off, it gives me a good scare too. Haven't seen paw prints on the stove since, and the days I see her looking up at the counter I just turn it back on. Works well to move it from place to place so she doesn't know the source of the spray and loses all confidence in jumping up there. Worked well for my household! Would definitely buy again if I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Unfortunately doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: The detector didn't seem to work at all. We'd wave our hands in front of it and nothing. Sometimes the cats would come up and get right in front of it with no effect. When it did kick off and spray, the cats seemed more annoyed than frightened. It usually took 2 or 3 sprays for them to be bothered enough to leave the area. As a whole, because it didn't work reliably, it was a pretty ineffective product.
customer_reviews.author: Frankie Cleary

customer_reviews.title: THIS!
customer_reviews.text: After my spoiled cat started peeing in a corner I did EVERYTHING. Cleaned ,deodorized, moved furniture ect. Came across this and said Hmmmmm. Yes it is pricey. So is replacing carpet. Put battery in, set it facing that corner and waited. Cat jumped 10 feet! Saw him come back the next day, sprayed again. Now he avoids that area( I do leave the can there) I would recommend this to any pet owner, My room smells fresh again! The sensor is a bit slow, but for my cat it ambushed him perfectly. Seriously I wish I knew about this years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Darlene

customer_reviews.title: not as good as I expected.
customer_reviews.text: They scare my cat away from sleeping on the back of my new sofa, but only if it is pointed exactly where she is going to lay. She learned quickly to avoid that corner. I find that I set the thing off more myself when I am moving around the house. I think it would work really well to set outside your bedroom door at night so the cat/cats would not come in and disturb your sleep. The product is just too small to work in much of an area.
customer_reviews.author: starla houff

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful solution to an annoying problem
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves to jump on top of my computer, but then I get cat hair and litter in my computer. I tried tape, but he just licks the adhesive off. I aimed this thing so it fires as soon as he jumps on the computer, and it has worked SO WELL. It's just a puff of air that sounds like a hiss, and it scares the heck out of him. I'm ok with that - he knows he isn't supposed to go on there. He hasn't done it since. My only problem is I forget it's there, so when I have to plug something into my PC, I scare myself half to death.
customer_reviews.author: Phil Colson

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: From first opening the sensor was slow to detect. Larger issue - the dispenser never stops dispensing. I've wasted almost the entire first canister trying to figure out how to make this work right (different locations, lighting conditions, turn it off and back on, re-installing the canister. Will be returning (because, as a person with a new 6 month old kitten at home, I totally have time to do that). I'm so disappointed. Especially because this seems to be the only such product on the market with any kind of reliably good review. **Edit: WOULD HAVE returned- but can't because the product contains flammable liquid (the canister). Contacting amazon. #2 - Refund issued by Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth A Green

customer_reviews.title: Such a great idea but not working
customer_reviews.text: I bought this ssscat for the second time, hoping the first time it was just a faulty product. Now this one worked only 3 days and again I have the same problem, cats walk by and it does nothing. I have a neutered spraying cat and I need to protect my furniture. It seems such a great idea and it is, but only when it hisses. I would buy 5 or 6 in an instant, but I dare not buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: Renate Jaeger

customer_reviews.title: Love this Product
customer_reviews.text: Scared the bejesus out of my kittens who are mischeivous and jump onto the counters at night! The first night I heart the can go off and alot of scrambling lolololol. I knew then and there that this was a great purchase. One of my kittens then devised a plan to sneak up behind the unit, which worked for one night. I then changed the location of the unit so she could no longer play behind it and she has no longer been on the counters. I highly recomment this product.
customer_reviews.author: Tanya

customer_reviews.title: Keeps the Boys Spraying at Bay!
customer_reviews.text: Unbelievable!! I have several cats and recently a couple of the males started marking a few spots. I tried several enzyme cleaners, sprays etc. to no avail. So my wife said let’s buy a couple of these in a couple of days and a couple of sprays from this device the boys got in line!! No more marking...
customer_reviews.author: epw

customer_reviews.title: Worked at first, sensor crapped out within a month
customer_reviews.text: Product was great to begin with. Then the motion sensor stopped working. I’ve tried moving the directions, I’ve changed the batteries, I’ve cleaned it just to make sure there isn’t something blocking it. The sensory DOES make it go off, just at random times when nothing is near it to make it go off. Seems like a great item, if you get one that will stay working. At this point I’m out of my return window and out $30 plus I bought three extra canisters that are now worthless unless I spend another $30 and hope the next one I get works for more than a month.
customer_reviews.author: rwarren1128

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This is a very disappointing unit. It goes off when it wants to irregardless of whether the cat walks by or not and at other times it just sits there like a dunce while the cat walks back and forth. However, if the wife walks by it triggers every time. What good is that? The batteries went dead in 4 days and the On/Off switch came off the first day so I had to stick the tip of my pocket knife blade in to turn it back on. In good conscience I can't recommend it. I wish I could get my money back.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Didn't deter my cat! Warrantry is useless. There is a better product.
customer_reviews.text: Product senses cat motion and emits a spray but does not deter my cat. She pretty much ignores it. Sent info to seller and requested a credit for useless product. Have not heard back from them. I cannot send this back because they will not allow the sending of product through mail (once it has been used). If you want something that does work, buy a DOBERMAN SECURITY Motion Detector Alarm with Nightlight Function – Model SE-0134. It is only $13.98 and really works and you do not have to use a dangerous and expensive chemical to control your cats behavior.
customer_reviews.author: William B.

customer_reviews.title: Updated Customer Care is Awesome Product Works Well
customer_reviews.text: Updated below. At first I thought this product would be great. It is top heavy and easily tips over. After a day and a half it stopped working. I cleaned the nozzle, checked the can of air, and reseated the sensor - nothing. I will call customer care and update this review. *I messaged the product customer service via their website and they were very helpful. They quickly sent a replacement with a return label for the non-working part. The second has been working without fail for several days now. Very pleased with the product and customer care.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

product_meta.title: PetSafe SSSCAT Spray Dog and Cat Deterrent, Motion Activated Pet Repellent Keeps Areas Pet Proof, Battery-Operated and Environmentally Friendly Training Sprayer – Protect Your Pets and Furniture
product_meta.description:
Style:SSSCAT Spray SystemPets are part of the family, but even fur babies need boundaries. Safely and quickly teach your cat or dog to avoid off limit areas inside your Home with the PetSafe SSSCAT Spray Deterrent. Use the spray to keep your cat off counter tops or furniture and your dog out of the trash can. The spray deterrent is also effective if you need to create Completely pet free zones. The motion activated sensor detects your pet when they are within 3 feet and releases a quick burst of spray. The odorless spray is harmless for your pet and does not stain surfaces. Each SSSCAT spray can contains approximately 80 100 bursts of spray.

Contains HFO-1234ze, a non-hazardous spray ingredient.

Includes:
SSSCAT Spray Deterrent
SSSCAT Spray Refill Can.
feature_bullets: Deters pets: Place the spray deterrent on countertops, next to trash cans or near furniture to quickly teach your dog or cat to avoid off-limit spaces
Pet-free zones: Use the spray deterrent to train pets to avoid specific rooms or areas in your home
Motion-activated: Motion sensor detects your pet when they are within 3 feet of the spray deterrent; Each can holds approximately 80-100 sprays
Replaceable: When empty, simply purchase a SSSCAT replacement can
Safe: The spray is harmless, odorless and does not stain surfaces; Spray is environmentally friendly and has zero ozone depletion
Battery-operated: Motion sensor requires 4 AAA batteries; Batteries not included
Quality guaranteed: PetSafe brand has been a trusted global leader in pet behavior, containment and lifestyle innovations for nearly 30 years; We help pets and their people live happily together

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
